d.title: 🐞 - "Admin" setting is missing from sidebar
d.body:
### What happened?

Link to get to manage SES configuration (/admin) is missing in the current release version : unsend/unsend:v1.5.4

But the page is available if we directly visit the page by entering {domain}/admin. May be we forgot to move the link when someone did the sidebar re-organization?

### Replication Steps

1. Log in to your unsend dashboard
2. On the left sidebar, the "Admin" option is missing
3. But, if you visit the url {domain}/admin directly, the page is accessible and functional.

### Self hosted or Cloud?

Self hosted

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome (or chrome based like Brave, Arc, etc)

d.title: 🐞 - Request fails when non required key is sent as null
d.body:
### What happened? `POST /api/v1/emails` will fail if you send non required keys with a `null` value. filtering out non required keys is an option, but makes writing an sdk where users can fill in combinations more tedious. I haven't tested all the cases, but this payload throws an `text field required` validation error `{ ..., "html": "
my html
", "text": null, ... }` ### Replication Steps _No response_ ### Self hosted or Cloud? Self hosted ### What browsers are you seeing the problem on? _No response_

d.title: 🐞 - Unsubscribe Link Missing When Sending Emails via API
d.body:
### What happened?

When sending emails directly via the API and using templates, the unsubscribe link is not added, even if the recipient already exists as a contact.

However, when sending the same email via a campaign, the unsubscribe link is correctly included.

This creates inconsistent behaviour between API-based sends and campaign sends.

### Replication Steps

_No response_

### Self hosted or Cloud?

Self hosted

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

_No response_

d.title: 🐞 - Prisma Migration Failure: Missing Tables + Prisma 7 Schema Incompatibility in Production Image
d.body: ### What happened? When deploying usesend/usesend:latest on a clean Postgres database (Dokploy), the application fails to boot because Prisma cannot access required tables. The Prisma Client throws: `P2021: The table `public.SesSetting` does not exist in the current database. ` Additionally, when attempting to run Prisma migrations inside the container, Prisma CLI fails: Prisma CLI requires @prisma/engines, which is not included in the production image. Prisma CLI 7 reports that datasource.url = env("DATABASE_URL") is no longer supported in schema.prisma. The container does not include a prisma.config.ts, which Prisma 7 now requires to define the datasource connection. As a result, it is impossible to run migrations inside the production container, and the app cannot create needed tables on first boot. ### Replication Steps 1. Deploy the Usesend Docker image with an empty Postgres database: usesend/usesend:latest 2. Set a valid DATABASE_URL (confirmed by echo "$DATABASE_URL" inside the container). 3. Start the app. The application crashes with: P2021: The table `public.SesSetting` does not exist ### Self hosted or Cloud? Self hosted ### What browsers are you seeing the problem on? _No response_

d.title: 🐞 - NEXT_PUBLIC_IS_CLOUD=true has no effect
d.body:
### What happened?

I am hosting the app for a client and want to enable the quota and billing metrics. 
As far as I understand, I have to use NEXT_PUBLIC_IS_CLOUD=true in the .env/docker compose/ file.
I have added the setting NEXT_PUBLIC_IS_CLOUD=true in the .env file and in my docker-compose.yaml file. 
However, when I start the app it has no effect. 
When I try to signup with an email address the logs are showing that app is running as self-hosted: 
`usesend  | {"level":30,"time":1759758612186,"service":"next-app","msg":"Sending email using self hosted"}`

Maybe I am misunderstanding something?  What is the correct way to enable the billing?

### Replication Steps

1. Add `NEXT_PUBLIC_IS_CLOUD=true` in your `.env` file.
2. Start docker stack
3. Docker stack is started as self-hosted ignoring the setting.

### Self hosted or Cloud?

Self hosted

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Firefox, Chrome (or chrome based like Brave, Arc, etc), Safari

d.title: 🐞 - Unable to re-add domain after removing it from hosted instance
d.body:
### What happened?

I had previously added a domain to the hosted app.unsend service.
After removing it there, I attempted to add the same domain to my self-hosted Unsend instance.

When I try to add it, I get the following error:

`Email identity {domain} already exist.`

It seems the identity is still reserved/locked on the hosted service, even after removal, which prevents re-adding it on self-hosted.

### Replication Steps

1. Add a domain on app.unsend.
2. Remove that domain from the hosted account.
3. Try to add the same domain on a self-hosted instance.
4. Observe the error above

### Self hosted or Cloud?

Self hosted

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome (or chrome based like Brave, Arc, etc)

d.title: 🐞 - SES Settings fail to save if AWS Secret has / sign
d.body:
### What happened?

In “Add SES Settings”, saving fails when the AWS Secret contains a “/”. Validation appears to parse the secret as a SigV4 credential scope and throws: "Credential must have exactly 5 slash-delimited elements, e.g. keyid/date/region/service/term, got 'xx/xxx/20251112/eu-west-1/sns/aws4_request'."

### Replication Steps

1. Use an AWS Secret with "/"

### Self hosted or Cloud?

Self hosted

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome (or chrome based like Brave, Arc, etc)

d.title: 🐞 - NOAUTH Authentication required.
d.body:
### What happened?

I do not have a password set on my Redis instance but Usesend is nonetheless failing to load after initially successfully doing so with the error:

```
2025-09-15T20:08:57.845818075Z o: NOAUTH Authentication required.
2025-09-15T20:08:57.845832003Z     at v (.next/server/chunks/16494.js:63:38568)
2025-09-15T20:08:57.845833722Z     at w.execute (.next/server/chunks/16494.js:63:41324) 
```

### Replication Steps

```Dockerfile
services:
  postgres:
    image: 'postgres:16'
    environment:
      - 'POSTGRES_USER=${SERVICE_USER_POSTGRES}'
      - 'POSTGRES_PASSWORD=${SERVICE_PASSWORD_POSTGRES}'
      - 'POSTGRES_DB=${SERVICE_DB_POSTGRES:-usesend}'
    healthcheck:
      test:
        - CMD-SHELL
        - 'pg_isready -U $${POSTGRES_USER} -d $${POSTGRES_DB}'
      interval: 5s
      timeout: 20s
      retries: 10
    volumes:
      - 'usesend-postgres-data:/var/lib/postgresql/data'
  redis:
    image: 'docker.dragonflydb.io/dragonflydb/dragonfly:latest'
    volumes:
      - 'usesend-redis-data:/data'
    command:
      - redis-server
      - '--maxmemory-policy'
      - noeviction
    healthcheck:
      test:
        - CMD
        - redis-cli
        - PING
      interval: 5s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 20
  certbot:
    image: serversideup/certbot-dns-cloudflare
    environment:
      CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN: "${CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN}"
      CERTBOT_EMAIL: "${CERTBOT_EMAIL}"
      CERTBOT_DOMAINS: "${CERTBOT_DOMAINS}"
    volumes:
      - /data/coolify/ssl:/etc/letsencrypt
    restart: unless-stopped
  usesend:
    image: 'usesend/usesend:latest'
    expose:
      - 3000
    environment:
      - SERVICE_URL_USESEND_3000
      - 'DATABASE_URL=postgresql://${SERVICE_USER_POSTGRES}:${SERVICE_PASSWORD_POSTGRES}@postgres:5432/${SERVICE_DB_POSTGRES:-USESEND}'
      - 'NEXTAUTH_URL=${SERVICE_URL_USESEND}'
      - 'NEXTAUTH_SECRET=${SERVICE_BASE64_64_NEXTAUTHSECRET}'
      - 'AWS_ACCESS_KEY=${AWS_ACCESS_KEY:?}'
      - 'AWS_SECRET_KEY=${AWS_SECRET_KEY:?}'
      - 'AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=${AWS_DEFAULT_REGION:?}'
      - 'GITHUB_ID=${GITHUB_ID}'
      - 'GITHUB_SECRET=${GITHUB_SECRET}'
      - 'REDIS_URL=redis://redis:6379'
      - 'NEXT_PUBLIC_IS_CLOUD=${NEXT_PUBLIC_IS_CLOUD:-false}'
      - 'API_RATE_LIMIT=${API_RATE_LIMIT:-1}'
      - 'HOSTNAME=0.0.0.0'
      - 'SMTP_AUTH_USERNAME=${SMTP_AUTH_USERNAME}''
    depends_on:
      postgres:
        condition: service_healthy
      redis:
        condition: service_healthy
    healthcheck:
      test:
        - CMD-SHELL
        - 'wget -qO- http://localhost:3000 || exit 1'
      interval: 5s
      retries: 10
      timeout: 2s
  smtp:
    container_name: usesend-smtp-server
    image: usesend/smtp-proxy:latest
    depends_on:
      certbot:
        condition: service_healthy
    environment:
      SMTP_AUTH_USERNAME: "${SMTP_AUTH_USERNAME}" 
      USESEND_BASE_URL: "https://send.freedom.engineering" 
      USESEND_API_KEY_PATH: "/certs/server.key"
      USESEND_API_CERT_PATH: "/certs/server.crt"
    volumes:
      - /data/coolify/ssl/live/freedom.engineering/privkey.pem:/certs/server.key:ro
      - /data/coolify/ssl/live/freedom.engineering/cert.pem:/certs/server.crt:ro
    ports:
      - "25:25" # Standard SMTP
      - "587:587" # SMTP with STARTTLS
      - "2587:2587" # Alternative SMTP port
      - "465:465" # SMTP over SSL/TLS
      - "2465:2465" # Alternative SMTPS port
    restart: unless-stopped
    labels:
      - traefik.enable=true
      - traefik.tcp.routers.smtps.rule=HostSNI(`send.freedom.engineering`)
      - traefik.tcp.routers.smtps.entrypoints=smtps
      - traefik.tcp.routers.smtps.service=smtps
      - traefik.tcp.services.smtps.loadbalancer.server.port=465
      - traefik.tcp.routers.submission.rule=HostSNI(`send.freedom.engineering`)
      - traefik.tcp.routers.submission.entrypoints=submission
      - traefik.tcp.routers.submission.service=submission
      - traefik.tcp.services.submission.loadbalancer.server.port=587
```

### Self hosted or Cloud?

Self hosted

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome (or chrome based like Brave, Arc, etc), Firefox

First click this 2. Navigate to this 3. Click this 4. See this ### Self hosted or Cloud? Cloud ### What browsers are you seeing the problem on? _No response_

d.title: Fix reverse tab-nabbing vulnerability in external links
d.body:
### What happened?

External links using target="_blank" without the rel attribute create a security vulnerability that allows opened pages to manipulate the parent window through window.opener. This can lead to reverse tab-nabbing attacks where malicious sites redirect users to phishing pages.

// Before
<Link 
 href="https://github.com/unsend-dev/unsend" 
 target="_blank"
>

// After
<Link 
 href="https://github.com/unsend-dev/unsend" 
 target="_blank" 
 rel="noopener noreferrer"
>

### Replication Steps

1. Navigate to apps/marketing/src/app/layout.tsx
2. Go to line 112
3. Observe the Link component with target="_blank" but missing rel attribute

### Self hosted or Cloud?

Self hosted

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

_No response_

d.title: 🐞 - Team invitation links not working properly
d.body:
### What happened?

I have deployed unsend on K8 and setup the initial team and invited a couple team members to join the unsend team.
When the team members click the link they received, they get redirected to login page, where they use their GitHub credentials to login, then they are redirected to a page asking them to create a team, which is not possible as the limit is 1 team per self-hosted instance. When visiting the link again or refreshing the page, they get a "No invites found" message on the page.

Upon little investigation on the DB, I've found that no entry was put in `TempUser` table for the invited team member. Once an entry was put manually, everything works fine.

### Replication Steps

1. Login to unsend dashboard as admin 
2. Navigate to `Settings` 
3. Click `Invite Members`
4. Copy the invitation link
5. Open a private browser window
6. Visit the link
7. Login with other GitHub credentials

### Self hosted or Cloud?

Self hosted

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome (or chrome based like Brave, Arc, etc)

d.title: 🐞 -  From validation rule broken
d.body:
### What happened?

Last release broke the following "from" email format:

`"Company Name" <noreply@companyname.com>`

(validation rule changed from "string" to "email")

This worked in previous releases, is a valid SES format and is the default format for Symfony mailer (PHP).

### Replication Steps

_No response_

### Self hosted or Cloud?

Self hosted

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

_No response_

d.title: 🐞 - Variable key shown when removing a team member
d.body:
### What happened?

Instead of the member email the variable name is shown, probably due to the double quotes. 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0dbcb268-9965-4207-ab9e-5d11386f974a)

### Replication Steps

1. Add a team member with email invite
2. Click delete team member

### Self hosted or Cloud?

Self hosted

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Firefox
